Action.author: knkski
Action.body: ~anastath : I was able to successfully run the intkey|https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth/blob/master/contracts/examples/simple_intkey/simple_intkey.sol example using the {{web3}} library. Would you be able to either provide the contract that you're experiencing this with, provide another screenshot with {{RUST_BACKTRACE=1}} added to this line|https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth/blob/master/docker-compose.yaml#L134 in {{docker-compose.yml}}, or both?

Action.author: anastath
Action.body: ~knkski : I reproduce the problem with the master branch I downloaded from here ( https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth|https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth ) on 2017-07-20. I cross checked on the source deployed on my PC that the change in this commit ( https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-seth/commit/0ff7164b9faf36bb43bbbca2f85f12cc5acb28f7#diff-961caa7dd651e71f1a60c1769920758c ) is included. So, this problem does persist after this commit.

Action.author: knkski
Action.body: ~anastath : What command are you using to start the RPC server? Also, can you try submitting a traceback with {{RUST_BACKTRACE=full}} enabled?

Action.author: knkski
Action.body: ~anastath : If you're using the docker commands to start the RPC server, can you try first running {{docker-compose build seth-rpc}} and then attempting the transaction again?

Action.author: anastath
Action.body: ~knkski : I ran RPC server with docker-compose. Unfortunately, I'll be out of office until 2018-08-16 and can't provide with these details any sooner.
